docs.lead_paragraph: During her one term in the House of Representatives, from a largely rural, traditionally Republican district, Kirsten E. Gillibrand was on safe political ground adopting a tough stance against illegal immigration.

headline.main: Gillibrand Draws Fire Over Immigration Views

docs.abstract: Also in the Morning Buzz: new costs for the parks connected to the Yankee Stadium project; a hiccup in the South Ferry station project; and more headlines from local papers.

docs.lead_paragraph: For Democrats, the stimulus bill is also a tool for rewriting the social contract with the poor, the uninsured and the unemployed.

docs.lead_paragraph: Andy Stern, president of the Service Employees International Union, said he was appointing two trustees to run a dissident local that represents 150,000 health care workers in California.

docs.lead_paragraph: After regulators refused to let it raise homeowner rates by nearly 50 percent, Florida’s largest private property insurer said it would shutter all its business in the state.

headline.main: Big Insurer Says It Will Quit Florida Property Market
headline.print_headline: Big Insurer, Denied Rate Increase, Says It Will Quit Florida Property Market

docs.snippet: After regulators refused to let it raise homeowner rates by nearly 50 percent, Florida’s largest private property insurer said it would shutter all its business in the state.

docs.lead_paragraph: Iraq’s land-for-journalists program illustrates the challenges democratic principles face when they clash with entitlements that were never before questioned.

docs.lead_paragraph: When you’re in the audience at a play about breast cancer, you don’t expect to laugh a lot. But in Andrea Lepcio’s top-notch play, spontaneous applause tends to break out.

headline.seo: J. Smith-Cameron Finds Humor Even in Cancer at the McGinn/Cazale Theater
headline.main: Dark Humor That’s Not Quite Ready for the Gallows
headline.print_headline: Dark Humor That’s Not Quite Ready for the Gallows

docs.snippet: When you’re in the audience at a play about breast cancer, you don’t expect to laugh a lot. But in Andrea Lepcio’s top-notch play, spontaneous applause tends to break out.

headline.main: Guest Column: A Low-Tech Treatment for Bee Plague

docs.abstract: Mobile fleets of honeybees, vital to our crops for their pollinating, are now at risk.
docs.snippet: Mobile fleets of honeybees, vital to our crops for their pollinating, are now at risk.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman in Southern California has given birth to eight babies, the world's second live-born set of octuplets. With advances in fertility treatment, multiple births are becoming more common, but how many are too many? What are the costs of delivering and caring for premature babies? And what about the emotional costs? We asked several experts to give us their thoughts.
docs.abstract: A woman recently gave birth to octuplets. With multiple births becoming more common, how many are too many?
docs.snippet: A woman recently gave birth to octuplets. With multiple births becoming more common, how many are too many?

docs.lead_paragraph: Traveling frugally means more than just cadging free bar snacks in Bologna or hopping low-cost flights between third-tier European airports. To keep costs to a minimum, you have to plan well in advance, and that means getting your finances in order.
docs.abstract: Traveling frugally means more than just cadging free bar snacks in Bologna or hopping low-cost flights between third-tier European airports. To keep costs to a minimum, you have to plan well in advance, and that means getting your finances in order.
